I am doing this for 1.14, and my way is to simply write a class that extend=
s
DecideRule, write the path of that class in a text file called
DecideRule=
.options  and jar the entire thing and put the jar in the lib of
your herit=
rix. Then, from the WUI, add the class you wrote as a submodule in
the HTTP=
 midfetch phase.

The key thing in that class is that you must overrise the=
 decideFor(Object
o) method in the original class and you can check the Cra=
wlURI for the
content type in that method and return ACCEPT or REJETC as yo=
u wish.

ow to specify the source (i
> refer to the NotMatchesFilePatternDecideRule =
set with the following
> property values: decision: REJECT usePresetPattern=
: CUSTOM regexp:
> .*(/|\.html)$). What i want instead is to download any t=
ext/* mime-types
> (i don't want video or images or data files) for pdfs, d=
oc, odt too.

> Any idea?

I am doing this for 1.14, and my way is to simply write a class that extend=
s DecideRule, write the path of that class in a text file called DecideRule=
.options =A0and jar the entire thing and put the jar in the lib of your her=
itrix. Then, from the WUI, add the class you wrote as a submodule in the HT=
TP midfetch phase.<div>
<br></div><div>The key thing in that class is that =
you must overrise the decideFor(Object o) method in the original class and =
you can check the CrawlURI for the content type in that method and return A=
CCEPT or REJETC as you wish.</div>

creating a sur=
fable archive i just want to download text mime-types. On<br>
the documenta=

refer to the N=
otMatchesFilePatternDecideRule set with the following<br>
property values: =
decision: REJECT usePresetPattern: CUSTOM regexp:<br>
.*(/|\.html)$). What =
i want instead is to download any text/* mime-types<br>
(i don't want v=
ideo or images or data files) for pdfs, doc, odt too.<br>
